course.title: Chaucer: The Canterbury Tales
course.description: One of the most astonishing, vibrant, multivalent texts in the English language, Chaucer's The Canterbury Tales contains characters high and low telling stories of edification and pleasure, in poetry and prose, on topics bawdy and pious. We will read this work in its entirety, while also looking at some of Chaucer's shorter poems and the historical and cultural milieu in which he wrote.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Aesthetic and Interpretive Understanding. This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
